posts.post_content: I'm guessing he's an eldrazi, hence the eldrazi monument, or something of that sort. Very powerful, I could see myself immediately trying to burn this guy off the field before he got to big, but then I haven't played against one yet.

Posted By: Pantheon (9/25/2009 9:21:14 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
ArKive, it is funny that you mention warpworld + landfall  
  
a friend of mine runs warpworld, and if landfall triggers in a warp, then you can get a devistating combo basicly placing your whole deck after a few warps with rampaging baloth, emeria angel, and seige gang comander  
  
the deck uses keeper of progenitus to power out warps at turn 5 (turn 4 is required to play the keeper, with out any other mana acceleration)  
  
our last game with warpworld, we went through 10 warps, and I am telling you, there are only 3 ways to effectively counter a warpworld, Blue [gather specimens](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=gather specimens), a deck designed to warp, ie another warpworld deck, or an ally deck running a play set of [turntimber ranger](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=turntimber ranger), and with the ally, you cross your fingers and hope you hit at least 1 turntimber early in the resolution giving you more permanents for the next warp  
  
and Ob, I see him in a few landfall g/b decks with the g/b fetch

posts.post_content:
I run three of these nice guys in a BWG landfall deck, which also sun four copies of [Knight of the Reliquary](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Knight of the Reliquary). He often pops off the top of your deck at the moste convenient timesm, when you for example have godt the mane to play him, a fetchland in hand and at least one copy of [Knight of the Reliquary](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Knight of the Reliquary) on the battlefield. When this happens your opponent will just go: "uh-oh, do I die?"   
  
Very good card, although legendary. Obviously he's been a planeswalker. But him being Garruk, is unlikely. I believe that the Zendikar block belongs to the battle between Jace and Chandra, since we've already been dissappointed about [Chandra Ablaze](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chandra Ablaze), and [Jace, the Mind Sculpturer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Jace, the Mind Sculpturer) has been revealed, to be a part of the Worldwake expansion. However, since we already got one black planeswalker in the block ([Sorin Markov](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sorin Markov)), I think it is most unlikely that we'll get another one in this block.  
  
But, he coul... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: 15 (11/14/2009 2:37:23 AM)

posts.post_content:
For a mythic rare, I also must say it's not all that rare. I got one in a fat pack, and my friend got three within a week of Zendikar being out.   
  
Without fetchlands, I wouldn't say he's that great. [Whispersilk Cloak](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Whispersilk Cloak) him and then he's a major threat. But without something like that, he's still good for life drain, and that gets annoying fast.
